clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Fiber Fortified Foods to the Diets of Chronic Kidney Disease Patients
clinical_study.official_title: An Investigation Into Pulse Fiber Fermentation and Nitrogen Excretion in Patients With Chronic Renal Failure

brief_summary.textblock: A single blind, six week dietary intervention will be conducted in order to evaluate the impact of fiber fortified foods on blood urea nitrogen, kidney function and quality of life in patients presenting with a moderate to severe decline in kidney function.

detailed_description.textblock: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) patients may consume lower than recommended amounts of dietary fiber due to typical dietary habits, dietary restrictions, and uremic symptoms. A progressive decline in kidney function causes an acculmulation of uremic molecules that contribute to further progression of the disease and reduced quality of life. In an effort to evaluate the impact of added fiber on blood urea nitrogen, kidney function and quality of life in patients presenting with a moderate to severe decline in kidney function (eGFR â‰¤ 50 mL/min/1.73 m2), a single blind, six week dietary intervention, clinical trial will be conducted.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of added fiber on blood urea nitrogen (BUN)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 42 days of the study
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples (10 mL) will be taken on day 1, 14, 28, and 42. BUN will be assayed using the Urea Nitrogen Concentrated Reagent method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of foods with added fiber on estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: eGFR will be calculated using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease formula on days 1, 14, 28 and 42 of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of foods with added fiber on Serum Creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine will be assayed using the ADVIA Chemistry CRE_2c method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of foods with added fiber on bowel movement frequency
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete daily diaries to evaluate bowel movement frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of foods with added fiber on Kidney Disease Quality of Life (KDQOL-36) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete the Kidney Disease Quality of Life (KDQOL-36) questionnaire for 4 specific days during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of foods with added fiber on Simplified Nutritional Appetite Questionnaire (SNAQ)
Impact of foods with added fiber on Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS)
Impact of foods with added fiber on Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale (GSRS)

arm_group.description: For a period of 2 weeks, participants will consume control foods in addition to their usual diets.
For a period of 4 weeks, participants will consume food fortified with fiber in addition to their usual diets.

intervention.description: For a period of 2 weeks, participants will consume control foods in addition to their usual diets.
For a period of 4 weeks, participants will consume food fortified with fiber in addition to their usual diets.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants must:
- Be 18 years of age or older
- Have eGFR (estimated glomerular filtration rate) of less than 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 (stage 3,4 and 5 but who are not on dialysis)
Exclusion Criteria:
Participants must not:
- Have been diagnosed with acute kidney injury (AKI)
- Have been diagnosed with glumerulonephritis (GN)
- Have been on immunosuppressant/steroid medications
- Be taking a probiotic supplement and refuse to discontinue it
- Be scheduled for dialysis within 3 months of study initiation
- Have a history of liver disease
- Be on dialysis
- Have undergone renal transplantation
- Be breastfeeding
- Have active gastrointestinal bleeding
- Have a change in medications over the past 4 weeks
